benchmark_details.name: SILENCER
benchmark_details.overview: SILENCER is a framework that neutralizes self-bias in LLM-as-Benchmark-Generator methods, allowing for the construction of high-quality benchmarks for evaluation through bias suppression techniques.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To mitigate self-bias in LLM-generated benchmarks and enhance evaluation accuracy.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: SILENCER incurs approximately 30% additional token costs.

data.source: BenchMaker method for benchmark generation, detailed in experiments.
data.size: Assumed size in experiments is 50 samples per benchmark.

methodology.calculation: Pearson correlation calculated between model performance on generated benchmarks and human-annotated benchmarks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher Pearson correlation indicates better performance and evaluation consistency.
methodology.baseline_results: Average Pearson correlation improved from 0.655 to 0.833.
methodology.validation: Extensive testing across various LLMs and benchmarks.

targeted_risks.harm: Mitigates potential risks of bias in generated benchmarks.
